intro: Polygala eutaxioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain the seeds. Polygala eutaxioides is often found in open vegetation types such as savannas and shrublands.
